Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, for God's sake. [notices Erin planking on parking lot curb]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Planking is a very stupid and dangerous trend. Basically, you lie like a plank in weird places. That's it. Sometimes you get run over. Welcome to the Internet.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Planking is one of those things where, eh, you either get it or you don't. And I don't. But I am so excited to be a part of it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [exiting elevator] After you my good sir.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I insist.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I insist.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The Search Committee finally decided, after a lot of deliberation, on Robert California... for the manager position. Who took one look around and left. He drove down to Florida and convinced Joe to make him CEO... CEO... her own job. He talked her out of her own job. And I don't really know how someone does that. But, anyway, then the position was his to fill. And he chose...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [drumroll with hands] I... it's unbelievable. True, I may have been the second choice, but I was the first-choice's first choice. And, about Dwight, I sensed that he might have some resentment about not getting the job so I sat him down and we had a talk. And I told him, "I need a really strong number two. I want you to be my enforcer." Smart, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: (planking on top of cabinet] Very smart.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, this has got to stop.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I can't get down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: K... Kevin! [Kevin planking on Dwight's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, at first, I was really disappointed, but I've got a great daily routine going right now. I have upped my karate to eight times a week. I've added boxing - lunches and on weekends. I do kickboxing three times a week. Krav Maga four times a week. An hour of meditation every morning at sunrise and again at sunset. So yeah, I'm doin' great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: K, I'm gonna need some help. Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think I should.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right here. Little Michael Scott- [points to her belly]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I told you I don't like that joke. It is a boy. We found out early.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Much different the second time around. And I have to say; it is nice not being the only pregnant woman in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Look, it's a 'Little Pregs' [points to her belly] and 'Big Pregs' [points to Pam's]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, when did we start calling it that-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Isn't it amazing, the difference in our sizes?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I am a few months ahead of you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I am having a child with my husband, the Senator. And Pam is having a child with Jim... the great salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hoist him aloft. C'mon Darryl. Lift, lift Darryl. [trying to lift Kevin off desk]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm lifting.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I wanted the manager job, but I got somethin' much better. This soda. This is mine.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It might be easier if you take a deep breath, lift from the knees, and shove it up your butt.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I came up with a new thing this summer. I act like I'm telling someone how to do somethin'. I go on with a long description and then I say, "and shove it up your butt." It's stupid, but it's my thing now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No one should be planking at all.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you, yes. Dwight, my enforcer, my number two, can you take care of this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Say no more.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [starts attacking plankers] Kids, don't try planking. It's dangerous. [knocks Toby off table] 'Specially with me around.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You watching that commercial again? [Pam nods] Why do you keep watching it, if you know it's just gonna make you cry?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because everything makes me cry, so what's the difference? This dog, he just wants to protect his bone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's got a bank vault. That's a start.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not enough though.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The new CEO works out of the conference room about half the time. But whenever he takes a break, he does these weird walks around the office. And you never know who he's gonna zero in on for these really intense small-talks. You just hope it's not you. And yet, you hope it is you too. It's strange.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Robert California. Let's have a conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Describe your day so far.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, I woke up. And I hit the snooze-

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: And when you recount your day, never say you woke up. It's a waste of your time. That's how every day's begun, for everyone, since the dawn of man.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Very smart, very smart. Suddenly, I was awake. And I've been doing this thing-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Robert. We have that 9:30am casual chit-chat scheduled. I emailed you about it last night to confirm. And again this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: First item on the agenda: can I get everyone an extra long Columbus Day weekend. Item number two, connect with the guy. Robert California, what does he think of me? Don't know, super care. Number three, time permitting, we lost our biggest client.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pam, pam. Psst. Pam. [motions her over, both looking at Robert's notebook]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim. [motions him over]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [motions he is on the phone] Can I call you right back? Thank you very much. [comes over] Okay. [sees notebook with two lists of staff names] What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The Friday before Columbus Day. Thoughts?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: What are your thoughts.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just making chit-chat. Kind of a medium year for women's soccer, no?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you looking at?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's, it's nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It can't be nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, it can't be nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's just a list of our names, split into two columns.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, just wait one second, alright? I will copy it. Do you have a pen?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Okay. Um, I'll take a photo of it. Dwight, can you throw me my phone?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [throws hard, Jim doesn't catch] Nice catch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If he comes out, distract him. [takes list to copier]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We need a warning signal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We don't need a warning signal, Kevin. We can see him right there-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I promise you, we don't need a warning-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! WARNING!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ahhh! [falls out of chair]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phyllis! Phyllis! You okay? You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah. Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ... 2, 3! [pulls Phyllis up]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thanks guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, which side of the list am I on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Left.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why are you- How do you know?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really great list of names guys. Thank you so much. Good work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, no, actually. That was in Robert's notebook.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He left it at reception and we photocopied it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. I don't want any part of this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe it's a list of people he's gonna fire.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, it's not that Pam. You know, I was thinking it reminds me of those lists Dwight used to make.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is if we were all on a cruise ship and had to divide into lifeboats. This is if we were on a cruise ship and had to divide into life rafts. Here's something. Who would eat who in an 'Alive' situation. No... that can't be it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I gotta say. Kinda seems like the left side's the side to be on. Me, Jim, Dwight, Darryl. No offense Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think it's-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 'Scuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shhh, Pam. C'mon, don't be such a right-sider.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Did you guys figure it out?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We couldn't crack it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Go in there and just ask the man what it means.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: He'll know that we looked at his private notebook.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: C'mon, just say you saw the list by accident.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm already working on this Columbus Day thing for you guys and it's starting to stack up. Feels like a lot. One thing at a time.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's all you had to do today was ask about Columbus Day?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [Andy continuously knocking on door] Yes, for god's sake Andy. Yes, come in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's up? Weird thing. Totally awkward, but you left your notebook on the reception desk.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Great. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And it was open. And people saw this. And they're just kinda going nuts and like wondering what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's a photocopy from your notebook.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You read my notebook? And photocopied it. And distributed it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. They did. And they asked me to ask about it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ah, please. Here's what it is. It's a doodle.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Some people doodle at work when they let their mind run. They draw houses, penises. Funny how the houses are always colonials and the penises are always circumcised. Don't you think? Well, I doodle too, but I'm not an artist. So I draw words and lists.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is fascinating. And, by the way, I am so glad I asked. People were just sort of- Did you just move my name?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Might as well have been sketching a cube.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay. Robert's in the annex, everybody think quick. What do these groups have in common?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Maybe we're s'posed to do it with people in our group.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: People in the other group.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmum, still wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stanley, you do puzzles all day. Whatdo we got?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Well, you take the first letter from each name, assign it a number, add 'em all up, and SHOVE IT UP YOUR BUTT!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. A little much needed comic relief, but we really need to figure this out guys.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I know! It's alphabetical.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [separately] No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it's not. Here's how we find out. Let's line up and compare the lines, see if we learn anything. Okay, left-siders over here. Right-siders, line up over here. Face each other. Match it by height and relative weight. Let's just size each other up here and left side of the list... ATTACK!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait! Stop! Stop! Stop! Will you stop?! [Kelly and Erin screaming as Dwight bashes their heads together, everyone attacking each other and yelling]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Warning! Warning! Warning!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [enters room, everyone quiets and separates] I'd like to invite the following people to join me for lunch: Jim, Dwight, Angela, Darryl, Kevin, Toby, Phyllis, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's great. Let's do this guys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, well, I will see you in a bit.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love you so much. [starting to cry]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. It's nothing. Alright? I'll text you when we get there. Let you know what's going on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. [turns to computer]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. No dog video.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. See you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, we should all be really excited about our very own pizza party. Pizza partay! Pizza! Partay! Pizza! Partay!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Jim, your daughter, Cecilia. What does she think of the street?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uhhh, the street?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Sesame street.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I didn't know anybody called it- She likes it a lot- she, uh, loves Elmo.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Elmo, god's sake, it's the Elmo era.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Sesame Street was created to reflect the environment of the children watching it. Complete self-absorption of Elmo is brilliantly reflective of our time. Ours is a cultural ghetto. Wouldn't you agree.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, she does like Elmo.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Cultural ghetto? Totally- totally agree.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Completely.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Apt. Apt analysis, Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The thing that I like about Elmo is the tickling.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I should not be here. I'm in the- I was in the wrong- I'm- I'm sorry. Uh, just picture me back there. I- I was never here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great group! Pizza party!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: How is this a pizza party?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, why don't you ask me again when the five pizzas get here.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, that's just pizza. You need at least one other element for it to be a party.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay. You guys ever had Margarita pizza?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fresh tomato with a dollop of mozzarella cheese.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's regular pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, I feel comfortable enough now to ask you this question... what made you pick this group?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I just think you guys are winners and I wanted to have lunch with you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [separately] Awww.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, what about the other guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Losers.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: C'mon.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I don't- I don't wanna say-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: C'mon, c'mon.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: C'mon.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ha, I guess I think they're losers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha ha, I knew it! Ha ha! Yes! Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Probably shouldn't have said that. [Jim's jaw drops]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah hah! Their interpretation of Margarita pizza. Fans of classic pizza will be psyched.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam's phone vibrates] Oh, text from Jim. "This is getting very weird. Will explain later."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Everyone's phone vibrates] Oh, text from Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: "Suck it losers."

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, not to point out the glaringly obvious, but doesn't the fact that I'm in this group make anyone feel just a little bit better? Oh! This crust is sharp!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I used to be young and cute and sorta funny and I could do those cute, little cartoons. And everyone who came through here was like, "Who's that receptionist? I like her." Now I'm just a fat mom. Yeah, and you take one look at me and you're like, "Oh, loser."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: C'mon Pam. Chins up, okay? Bad joke. Look around this room. Does this look like a group of losers? Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. Oh God.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [door opens, others enter] Oh. Hey guys! We had so much fun. We had Margarita pizza. We all hung out. Got to know each other better. How was your lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It was excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Good times.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, we did. It was the best time. And you know what? Now it's over. Back to work everyone. You too Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I knew it. I just knew, my whole life, that everyone was wrong about me. My parents, my teachers, my friends, the doctors. Everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that was certainly an odd lunch. Is everything alright?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm fine.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [spraying Meredith and Creed with water gun] Loser. Losers. [Dwight holding up "L" to his forehead]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [on the phone, while getting sprayed] Just take the casserole out of the- Take it out of the refrigerator and put it in the oven. It'll be fine, just leave it in for 20 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: When I was a salesman I could just be like "Not my job, not my prob. I'm going to the warehouse to polish my knob." Metaphorically, of course. But now, it is my job and my prob.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi, Robert? Can you come out here please it's really important. Just wanted to clarify something. Some people here are under the misconception that some people may be considered, uh, let's say top-tier and others would be second-tier.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I never said that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. Great. Robert. I said winners and losers. Is that what you're talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, that, it might- That might actually be what I'm thinking of. Can you clarify that?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Let me tell you some things I find productive. Positive reinforcement. Negative reinforcement. Honesty. I'll tell you some things I find unproductive. Constantly worrying about where you stand based on inscrutable social clues. And then, inevitably reframing it all in a reassuring way so that you can get to sleep at night. No, I do not believe in that at all. If I invited you to lunch, I think you're a winner. If I didn't, I don't. But I just met you all. Life is long, opinions change. Winners prove me right. Losers, prove me wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Whew, well. I guess that's that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy, don't go in there!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm going in there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know that every time I talk to you things just seem to get worse. But, you don't know these people and I do. And if I let you work with faulty information, well, then I'm not doing my job as regional manager. So, please take this pen and change your list.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna change my list, Andy, and I don't use ballpoint pens.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, then I will make a new list for you. Stanley... you may think he's a lazy grump, but did you know that he has the most consistently high sales numbers of anyone in this office? And you may think he's hard to love, but did you know that he's in, not one, but two long-term romantic relationships?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I did not know about the sales figures.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Meredith Palmer... Supplier relations. The word "no" not even in her vocabulary. And just to show you that I'm being fair. You had Gabe in the loser column. I think that is astute. Good call. Pam, easily the most creative and kind person I have ever worked with.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, shut the door. This is just gross.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shhh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin Hannon, the receptionist and my closest confidant. A winner if there ever was one.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I like my new group. I liked my old group.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Are we done?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes. No! The Friday before Columbus Day, we're gonna take a half-day, so that everyone can get a jump on the long weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You want a three and half day weekend for Columbus Day?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: And you are aware that Columbus and his legions committed genocide against an entire civilization of Native Americans.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't care. [Robert smiles as Andy exits]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey guys. So Columbus Day, we got that half-day on Friday.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We get that every year.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, you got it this year too.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Good night, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Night.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good night Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Night.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, I'm gonna go warm up the car.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Oh, uh, you dropped something. Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, I know I've been crying easily today, but- [shows unfolded paper Jim dropped, shows two lists, "Pam" and "Cece" on one side, "Everything else" on the other] I mean, that's just pretty killer, right? I mean, maybe it's stupid. No. [starts crying] It's wonderful. I'm gonna frame it. I can always unframe it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I gotta say, I think it's kinda cool not knowing. It's like one of those movies that ends on a note of mystery. Did the butler do it? Are they ghosts? You know? It's kinda sophisticated.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Everybody hates those endings!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [weepy] Yeah, I hate those endings.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I- [Sees Kevin looking at the list upside down and turns it.]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I was looking for patterns.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's all a mind game. He wanted us to see the list. He's a genius. You guys just don't get him.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I made a list like this for Congress when I worked in Hollywood in the 50's, they're meaningless.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Guys. Really, it's ok. Everyone has made a really solid first impression, I don't think there's any reason for anybody to worry.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I am on the wrong side, and I am freaking out here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grunting, trying with Jim to lift Kevin planking on his desk] Man, it's like hoisting a manatee. I can't get a grip it's so vast.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ryan? A little help?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God. How do whalers do it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Here's the way trends move across the country. They start in Japan. L.A. And New York get it soon after that. Seattle looks at it, decides not to do it. Chicago gets it three months later. Then it travels down the Mississippi, OK? All the red states start doing it. Good Morning America does a piece about it. And then, it shows up in Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Creed! Wha- [Shoves Creed with his foot, Creed grunts] This is a safety issue with you. There's no way to know if you're dead!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Good morning. [suitcase falls and he laughs awkwardly]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Corporate wants me up here, Dunder Mifflin wants me down there. What they worked out is that Monday, Wednesday and Friday I'm here in Scranton, Tuesday Thursday I'm in Tallahassee, I mean I feel like Vera Farmiga in Up in the Air, you know? More money more problems. Although, I didn't get a raise, so you know. Same money, more problems.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's called owling. You'll read about it in like eight months.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, I will have the chicken piccata with a side salad.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: That sounds good.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Chicken piccata, side salad.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Chicken piccata, salad on the side please.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll start with a side salad and uh, oh, chicken piccata.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Chicken piccata, side salad.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Side salad, chicken piccata on the side.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'll start with a side salad, then a chicken piccata.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Steak. Rare.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Jim, you alright? What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good. What? Nothin'

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! Text from Jim. "This is..." hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Profound man, your husband.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One more. To our boss!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think we have to do this again cause it's gonna take a whole. [everyone clinks glasses]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? Let us treat you. What do you say? It has been such a pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I can expense it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl & Oscar
Quote.Text: Let him expense it, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I insist. It is gonna be our treat, please?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Hi, Mr. Shrute. I've waited on you before. I just wanted to let you know that gratuity is not included in the bill and tips are expected.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, tips are expected?

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Yes sir.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then expect to be shocked. Jim, you owe me $14.75. Oscar, $14.75. Darryl....

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: My entire childhood, I was the one left out, and I said to myself: Gabe, if you just achieve some success, you'll be part of them. You'll be part of the happy ones. But instead, people just used my success as a new way to shut me out.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, this ain't no Breakfast Club, bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoo! Yeah! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Winners!
